question.text: In which of the following case, mice will remain alive in Griffith's transforming experiments?

options.text: Heat killed S - strain injected into mice.
DNA from heat killed S - strain + R - strain injected into mice.
More than one option is correct

solution.text:
Transforming Principle (by Frederick Griffith, 1928)

- Frederick Griffith has done experiments on bacteria Streptococcus pneumonia. This bacteria causes pneumonia.

- Griffith has observed the change in the physical form of the bacteria during the experiments.

- Streptococcus pneumonia produces 2 types of colonies :

1. Smooth and shiny colonies (S - strain or virulent strain) - Bacteria possess mucous

(polysaccharide) coat.

2. Rough colonies (R - strain) - Bacteria lacks mucous coat.
 
Step 1 S –strain injected into the mice Mice die
Step 2 R –strain injected into the mice Mice live
Step 3 Heat killed S –strain injected into the mice Mice live
Step 4 Heat killed S –strain + R –strain injected into the mice Mice die
